BodyName: Committee on Consumer and Worker Protection

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing exemptions for third-party food delivery services from the limits on fees charged by such services on food service establishments
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Establishing exemptions for third-party food delivery services from the limits on fees charged by such services on food service establishments.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing charitable organizations to conduct games of chance at professional sporting venues, and to repeal subdivision 8 of section 20-435 of such code, which defines the term “Prize.”
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Allowing charitable organizations to conduct games of chance at professional sporting venues, and to repeal subdivision 8 of section 20-435 of such code, which defines the term “Prize.”

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of consumer and worker protection to implement an outreach and education campaign regarding the Temporary Schedule Change Act
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Hearing Held by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of consumer and worker protection to implement an outreach and education campaign regarding the Temporary Schedule Change Act.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to establishing exemptions for third-party food delivery services from the limits on fees charged by such services on food service establishments
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Establishing exemptions for third-party food delivery services from the limits on fees charged by such services on food service establishments.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to requiring the department of consumer and worker protection to implement an outreach and education campaign regarding the Temporary Schedule Change Act
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Requiring the department of consumer and worker protection to implement an outreach and education campaign regarding the Temporary Schedule Change Act.

Items.Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to allowing charitable organizations to conduct games of chance at professional sporting venues, and to repeal subdivision 8 of section 20-435 of such code, which defines the term “Prize.”
Items.ActionText: This Introduction was Laid Over by Committee
Items.MatterName: Allowing charitable organizations to conduct games of chance at professional sporting venues, and to repeal subdivision 8 of section 20-435 of such code, which defines the term “Prize.”

Items.MinutesNote: Other Council Members Attending: Holden and Salamanca
